title: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
text:
** Investment management firm Holocene Advisors said that Merck & Co 's proposed offer of $180 per share for Acceleron Pharma Inc significantly undervalues the company.

** Suriname state oil company Staatsolie said it had signed a 30-year production sharing contract with U.S. producer Chevron Corp for the South American country's offshore Block 5.

** Brazilian retailer Lojas Americanas SA , has ended talks about a potential acquisition of Marisa Lojas , two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

** SeatGeek agreed to go public in a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company, backed by baseball executive Billy Beane of "Moneyball" fame, giving the online ticketing firm an enterprise value of $1.35 billion.

** Standard Chartered Plc announced a 10-year fintech partnership with Singapore-based Atome Financial on Wednesday to help it grab a piece of the booming buy now, pay later market in Asia that has thrived during the pandemic.

** Invesco said it facilitated talks between India's Reliance Industries and Zee Entertainment earlier this year on a possible merger, revealing for the first time that India's richest man, Mukesh Ambani , was interested in the television giant.

** Private equity firm Francisco Partners has agreed to invest in legal software platform Paradigm in a deal that valued the firm at $400 million, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

** UK insurance firm Howden Group has bought UK insurance broker Aston Lark from Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Bowmark Capital, the firms said.

** Prony Resources said Tesla Inc had agreed to purchase around 42,000 tonnes of nickel in a multi-year deal - a pact that is set to make the New Caledonian miner a key supplier of the metal to the U.S. electric car maker.

** Advertising group WPP said its public relations unit Finsbury Glover Hering would merge with peer SVC to form a new company worth about $917 million, and Roland Rudd would remain a co-chairman of the combined entity.

** A consortium led by private equity giant KKR & Co is nearing a deal to buy rights to music by pop icons Lorde and The Weeknd for $1.1 billon, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the talks.

** Global commodities giant Glencore Plc said on Tuesday that it had reached an agreement to sell its zinc business in Bolivia to Canada's Santa Cruz Silver Mining for some $110 million.
